attributes.action: ask Leeds United chariman Ken Bates to review his decision to end BBC Radio Leeds' live broadcasting rights of Leeds United matches
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Leeds United Football Club chairman Ken Bates has decided against renewing BBC Radio Leeds live broadcasting rights of Leeds United matches.
This means that there will be no way to listen to Leeds United games on an FM frequency.
A 'sizeable' number of BBC Radio Leeds listeners are pensioners and they will no have to buy digital radios to listen to live coverage of Leeds United.
Radio Leeds has been providing live coverage for 40 years.
Leeds United needs FM Coverage of its games for the sake of all fans, young and old.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
